verses.text: Give \w ear|strong="H0238"\w* to my \w prayer|strong="H8605"\w*, O \w God|strong="H0430"\w*; and \w hide|strong="H5956"\w* not thyself from my \w supplication|strong="H8467"\w*.\f + \fr 55.1 \ft chief…: or, overseer\f*\f + \fr 55.1 \ft Maschil: or, of instruction\f*
\w Attend|strong="H7181"\w* unto me, and \w hear|strong="H6030"\w* me: I \w mourn|strong="H7300"\w* in my \w complaint|strong="H7879"\w*, and make a \w noise|strong="H1949"\w*;

Because of the \w voice|strong="H6963"\w* of the \w enemy|strong="H0341"\w*, \w because|strong="H6440"\w* of the \w oppression|strong="H6125"\w* of the \w wicked|strong="H7563"\w*: for they \w cast|strong="H4131"\w* \w iniquity|strong="H0205"\w* upon me, and in \w wrath|strong="H0639"\w* they \w hate|strong="H7852"\w* me.

My \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* is sore \w pained|strong="H2342"\w* \w within|strong="H7130"\w* me: and the \w terrors|strong="H0367"\w* of \w death|strong="H4194"\w* are \w fallen|strong="H5307"\w* upon me.

\w Fearfulness|strong="H3374"\w* and \w trembling|strong="H7461"\w* are \w come|strong="H0935"\w* upon me, and \w horror|strong="H6427"\w* hath \w overwhelmed|strong="H3680"\w* me.\f + \fr 55.5 \ft overwhelmed: Heb. covered\f*

And I \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Oh \w that|strong="H5414"\w* I had \w wings|strong="H0083"\w* like a \w dove|strong="H3123"\w*! \add for then\add* would I fly \w away|strong="H5774"\w*, and be at \w rest|strong="H7931"\w*.
Lo, \add then\add* would I \w wander|strong="H5074"\w* far \w off|strong="H7368"\w*, \add and\add* \w remain|strong="H3885"\w* in the \w wilderness|strong="H4057"\w*. \w Selah|strong="H5542"\w*.
I would \w hasten|strong="H2363"\w* my \w escape|strong="H4655"\w* from the \w windy|strong="H7307"\w* \w storm|strong="H5584"\w* \add and\add* \w tempest|strong="H5591"\w*.

\w Destroy|strong="H1104"\w*, O \w Lord|strong="H0136"\w*, \add and\add* \w divide|strong="H6385"\w* their \w tongues|strong="H3956"\w*: for I have \w seen|strong="H7200"\w* \w violence|strong="H2555"\w* and \w strife|strong="H7379"\w* in the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*.

\w Day|strong="H3119"\w* and \w night|strong="H3915"\w* they go \w about|strong="H5437"\w* it upon the \w walls|strong="H2346"\w* thereof: \w mischief|strong="H0205"\w* also and \w sorrow|strong="H5999"\w* \add are\add* in the \w midst|strong="H7130"\w* of it.

\w Wickedness|strong="H1942"\w* \add is\add* in the \w midst|strong="H7130"\w* thereof: \w deceit|strong="H8496"\w* and \w guile|strong="H4820"\w* \w depart|strong="H4185"\w* not from her \w streets|strong="H7339"\w*.

For \add it was\add* not an \w enemy|strong="H0341"\w* \add that\add* \w reproached|strong="H2778"\w* me; then I could have \w borne|strong="H5375"\w* \add it:\add* neither \add was it\add* he that \w hated|strong="H8130"\w* me \add that\add* did \w magnify|strong="H1431"\w* \add himself\add* against me; then I would have \w hid|strong="H5641"\w* myself from him:

But \add it was\add* thou, a \w man|strong="H0582"\w* mine \w equal|strong="H6187"\w*, my \w guide|strong="H0441"\w*, and mine \w acquaintance|strong="H3045"\w*.\f + \fr 55.13 \ft mine equal: Heb. according to my rank\f*

We took \w sweet|strong="H4985"\w* \w counsel|strong="H5475"\w* \w together|strong="H3162"\w*, \add and\add* \w walked|strong="H1980"\w* unto the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of \w God|strong="H0430"\w* in \w company|strong="H7285"\w*.\f + \fr 55.14 \ft We…: Heb. Who sweetened counsel\f*

Let \w death|strong="H4194"\w* \w seize|strong="H5377"\w* upon them, \add and\add* let them go \w down|strong="H3381"\w* \w quick|strong="H2416"\w* into \w hell|strong="H7585"\w*: for \w wickedness|strong="H7451"\w* \add is\add* in their \w dwellings|strong="H4033"\w*, \add and\add* \w among|strong="H7130"\w* them.\f + \fr 55.15 \ft hell: or, the grave\f*
As for me, I will \w call|strong="H7121"\w* upon \w God|strong="H0430"\w*; and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall \w save|strong="H3467"\w* me.

\w Evening|strong="H6153"\w*, and \w morning|strong="H1242"\w*, and at \w noon|strong="H6672"\w*, will I \w pray|strong="H7878"\w*, and cry \w aloud|strong="H1993"\w*: and he shall \w hear|strong="H8085"\w* my \w voice|strong="H6963"\w*.

He hath \w delivered|strong="H6299"\w* my \w soul|strong="H5315"\w* in \w peace|strong="H7965"\w* from the \w battle|strong="H7128"\w* \add that was\add* against me: for there were \w many|strong="H7227"\w* with me.

\w God|strong="H0410"\w* shall \w hear|strong="H8085"\w*, and \w afflict|strong="H6030"\w* them, even he that \w abideth|strong="H3427"\w* of \w old|strong="H6924"\w*. \w Selah|strong="H5542"\w*. Because they have no \w changes|strong="H2487"\w*, therefore they \w fear|strong="H3372"\w* not \w God|strong="H0430"\w*.\f + \fr 55.19 \ft Because…: or, With whom also there be no changes, yet they\f*

He hath put \w forth|strong="H7971"\w* his \w hands|strong="H3027"\w* against such as be at \w peace|strong="H7965"\w* with him: he hath \w broken|strong="H2490"\w* his \w covenant|strong="H1285"\w*.\f + \fr 55.20 \ft broken: Heb. profaned\f*

\add The words\add* of his \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w* were \w smoother|strong="H2505"\w* than \w butter|strong="H4260"\w*, but \w war|strong="H7128"\w* \add was\add* in his \w heart|strong="H3820"\w*: his \w words|strong="H1697"\w* were \w softer|strong="H7401"\w* than \w oil|strong="H8081"\w*, yet \add were\add* they drawn \w swords|strong="H6609"\w*.

\w Cast|strong="H7993"\w* thy \w burden|strong="H3053"\w* upon the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and he shall \w sustain|strong="H3557"\w* thee: he shall \w never|strong="H5769"\w* \w suffer|strong="H5414"\w* the \w righteous|strong="H6662"\w* to be \w moved|strong="H4131"\w*.\f + \fr 55.22 \ft burden: or, gift\f*

But thou, O \w God|strong="H0430"\w*, shalt bring them \w down|strong="H3381"\w* into the \w pit|strong="H0875"\w* of \w destruction|strong="H7845"\w*: \w bloody|strong="H1818"\w* and \w deceitful|strong="H4820"\w* \w men|strong="H0582"\w* shall not live out \w half|strong="H2673"\w* their \w days|strong="H3117"\w*; but I will \w trust|strong="H0982"\w* in thee.\f + \fr 55.23 \ft bloody…: Heb. men of bloods and deceit\f*\f + \fr 55.23 \ft shall…: Heb. shall not half their days\f*
